wikipedia_page.main: Peter Simon Liss CBE FRS (born 27 October 1942) is a British environmental scientist, and professorial fellow, at the University of East Anglia.

response: Present faculty include former IPCC Chairman Sir Robert Watson;‘WATSON, Sir Robert (Tony)’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 scientists Sir David Hopwood,‘HOPWOOD, Sir David (Alan)’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Phil Jones,‘JONES, Prof. Philip Douglas’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Corinne Le Quéré, Jonathan D. G. Jones,‘JONES, Jonathan Dallas George’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Enrico Coen,‘COEN, Prof. Enrico Sandro’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Frederick Vine‘VINE, Prof. Frederick John’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and Peter Liss;‘LISS, Prof. Peter Simon’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014

Hubert Lamb retired in 1978. His successors were Tom Wigley (1978–1993), Trevor Davies (1993–1998), Jean Palutikof and Phil Jones (jointly 1998–2004), Phil Jones (2004–2016), and Tim Osborn (from January 2017); Peter Liss was acting director during investigations between December 2009 and July 2010. In 1984, the unit moved to a new cylindrical building designed by Rick Mather. In 2006, this was named the Hubert Lamb Building in honour of the first director.
* Peter Liss (Castle) – Emeritus Professor of Environmental Science at the University of East Anglia
